sentences.en: a game of football used as a metaphor for the competitive struggle of life
sentences.cn: 用来喻指生活中的激烈斗争的一场足球比赛

sentences.en: Advertising is an intensely competitive business.
sentences.cn: 广告业是一个竞争激烈的行业。

sentences.en: Are your products and services competitive? How about marketing?
sentences.cn: 你们的产品和服务有竞争力吗？营销又怎么样呢？

sentences.en: Business is a competitive activity. It is very fierce and very unforgiving.
sentences.cn: 商场如战场，竞争激烈，不近人情。

sentences.en: Competitive sports encourage children to work together as a team.
sentences.cn: 竞技体育鼓励孩子们进行团队协作。

sentences.en: He did not particularly want to take up a competitive sport.
sentences.cn: 他并不特别想从事竞技体育运动。

sentences.en: He has always been ambitious and fiercely competitive.
sentences.cn: 他一直都雄心勃勃，而且极其好胜。

sentences.en: He is respected as a very aggressive and competitive executive.
sentences.cn: 他是一位锐意进取、竞争意识很强的主管，颇受尊敬。

sentences.en: It's hard to maintain competitive pricing.
sentences.cn: 维持具有竞争力的定价非常困难。

sentences.en: Our workforce is highly trained and competitive.
sentences.cn: 我们的员工队伍训练有素，竞争意识强。

sentences.en: Some kinds of business are competitive.
Some US industries are not as competitive as they have been in the past.
sentences.cn: 美国有些行业不如以前有竞争力了。

sentences.en: The company say they're able to keep pricing competitive.
sentences.cn: 该公司说他们能够使定价保持竞争力。

sentences.en: The fast-food business is intensely competitive.
The team seems to have lost its competitive edge recently (= its ability to compete well ) .
sentences.cn: 这支球队近来好像丧失了竞争优势。

sentences.en: These businessmen are both competitive and honourable.
sentences.cn: 这些商人既有竞争性又很诚实.

sentences.en: These days he is ferociously competitive.
sentences.cn: 这些天来他极其争强好胜。

sentences.en: Through superior production techniques they were able to gain the competitive edge.
sentences.cn: 凭借先进的生产技术，他们得以占据竞争优势。

sentences.en: UK companies face a stark choice if they want to stay competitive.
sentences.cn: 英国公司如果想要保持竞争力就不得不面对严峻的选择。

phrases.tran_cn: 竞争激烈的就业市场；充满竞争的就业市场
竞争地位；竟争水平，竞争能力
竞争价格；公开招标价格
竞争态势；竞争环境；竞争性的局面
竞技性运动；竞赛体育运动
